p: The HMBC spectrum exhibited noticeable correlations between protons at δ H 5.30 ppm [H–C(5)] and the carbon atoms at δ C 173.6 ppm [C(4)] and 156.8 ppm [C(7)], between protons at δ H 6.88 ppm [H–N(6)] and carbon atoms at δ C 173.6 [C(4)], 62.4 [C(5)] and 156.8 [C(7)]. Other correlations were found between nitrogenous protons at δ H 8.04 [H–N(1)] ppm and carbon atoms at δ C 157.3 ppm [C(2)], δ C 173.6 ppm [C(4)] and 62.4 ppm [C(5)]. The UV spectrum of 2 (Fig. 2) exhibited one major maximum at λ max = 296 nm, different from values of 1 [ 19].
